meanings.definition: superlative form of drag, meaning most boring or tedious
meanings.sent1: The lecture on rocks was the draggiest part of the science class.
meanings.sent2: The rainy Monday morning commute was the draggiest ever.
meanings.sent3: Watching paint dry is more exciting than sitting through the draggiest movie.
meanings.sent4: The draggiest task of the day was organizing the old files in the dusty basement.
meanings.sent5: The draggiest book in the library had no pictures and a hundred pages of footnotes.

meanings.definition: superlative form of drag, meaning most slow or sluggish
meanings.sent1: The snail was the draggiest creature in the garden, moving at a snail's pace.
meanings.sent2: The draggiest turtle in the pond barely moved despite the warm sun.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was feeling particularly draggiest today, barely lifting a paw.
meanings.sent4: The draggiest car on the highway was causing a long line of frustrated drivers.
meanings.sent5: The draggiest sloth in the zoo seemed to be in slow motion compared to the others.
